page.title: 20FARMING IN THE HORLEY AREA
page.content: The land in this area was once swamps but drainage made it useable farmland. In the last 50 years a lot of the land between Horley and Smallfield has been used for residential development. More recently Gatwick Airport has led the use of the land for the many airport services. These include car parks, warehouses, the passenger terminal, and the approach roads, including the M23 with its junction, and the airport link road. In spite of this about 50% of the block is still farmed. These farms consist of small nurseries and market gardens, dairy and beef cattle, sheep, poultry and a few pigs. Many farms grow their own feed crops including wheat, barley, oats, beans and maize.Many roads in the area are lined with private houses having small acreages used for horses, or boarding and breeding kennels.
